content.description: For a certain dog breed, the number of puppies in a litter typically varies from 2 to 6. The following table shows the probability distribution of the random variable <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the number of puppies in a litter. Also shown are the squared deviations, or distances, from the expected value of 4.5 for the distribution.
content.question: Number of puppies 2 3 4 5 6 Squared deviation 6.25 2.25 0.25 0.25 2.25 Probability 0.05 0.15 0.25 0.35 0.20 What is the variance of the distribution?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.8: Mean and Standard Deviation of Random Variables

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
